title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. The amendment increases the credit percentage for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property to 50 percent. There is no dollar limitation for property related to hydrogen. The credit is allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads. The Code is amended to increase the credit percentage for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property to 50 percent, with no dollar limitation. The credit is applicable for refueling property for specific motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads. The Code is amended to include off-highway vehicles in the definition of specified motor vehicles for hydrogen fuel storage. The Code is amended to include off-highway vehicles as specified motor vehicles for hydrogen fuel storage, regardless of the type of vehicle. The term 'specified off-highway vehicles' refers to all motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, including fork lift trucks, regardless of registration for highway use. The term 'specified off-highway vehicles' includes motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding certain equipment like farm tractors and bulldozers. The term 'specified off-highway vehicles' excludes certain equipment like farm tractors and bulldozers. The credit for hydrogen property is extended through December 31, 2016. The credit for hydrogen property is extended through December 31, 2016, and the amendments made by subsections (a) and (c) apply to property placed in service after the enactment date in taxable years ending after that date. The repeal of the limitation in subsection (b) applies to taxable years beginning after the enactment date. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (c) apply to property placed in service after the enactment date in taxable years ending after that date. The amendment made by subsection (b) applies to taxable years beginning after the enactment date, while the amendment made by subsection (d) applies to hydrogen refueling property placed in service after December 31, 2014. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50 percent increase for qualified fuel cell property used in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency percentage of 70 percent or more. The investment credit for more efficient fuel cells has been increased, with a 50 percent increase for qualified fuel cell property used in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency percentage of 70 percent or more. The investment credit for more efficient fuel cells has been increased to 40 percent for qualified fuel cell property used in a system with an energy efficiency percentage of at least 60 percent but less than 70 percent. Increased maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property under section 48(c)(1) of the Code is amended to 40 percent. Amendments to section 48(a)(2)(A) include changes to subclause (I) and clause (iv) to clarify eligibility criteria. Amendments to section 48(a)(2)(A) of the Code clarify eligibility criteria for qualified fuel cell property. The maximum credit under section 48(c)(1) is increased to 40 percent. The maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property is amended under section 48(a)(2)(A) of the Code. The credit limit for such property placed in service during the taxable year is specified based on capacity. The maximum credit for qualified fuel cell property is amended under section 48(a)(2)(A) of the Code, with specific limits based on capacity: $2,500 for each 0.5 kilowatt for property in subsection (a)(2)(A)(i), $2,000 for property in subsection (a)(2)(A)(ii), and $1,500 for property in subsection (a)(2)(A)(iii)(I). The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
